intro: Delissea bondiana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Its leaves are velvety and often have a striking coloration, while its flowers come in a variety of colors including pink, purple, and white. Delissea bondiana is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
